Name: Provision of feminine hygiene products in schools.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of feminine hygiene products in schools

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Int No. 1128-A was not signed at the Mayoral public hearing; bill-signing ceremony subsequently scheduled for July 13, 2016.

History.Description: This Introduction was Bill Signing Scheduled by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: Bill signing scheduled to be held at the High School for Violin and Dance, 1110 Boston Road, Bronx, NY 10456.

History.Description: This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Education (DOE) to make feminine hygiene products available at no cost to students in the bathrooms of school buildings located in facilities that are leased by the DOE or over which DOE has care, custody, and control, serving female students in grades six through twelve.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
                     Section 1. Chapter 8 of title 21-A of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-968 to read as follows:
                     � 21-968 Provision of feminine hygiene products in schools. 
      a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the following terms have the following meanings. 
 	Feminine hygiene products. The term "feminine hygiene products" means tampons and sanitary napkins for use in connection with the menstrual cycle.
      School building. The term "school building" means any facility that is leased by the department or over which the department has care, custody and control, in which there is a public school, including a charter school, serving female students in grades six through twelve.
      b. The department shall make feminine hygiene products available at no cost to students in bathrooms of school buildings.                 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after enactment.
